reviews.text: I know for many years about this place. Service is good, atmosphere is good but you never learned how properly prepare and give to your customers delicious and real lulya kebab. Sorry for saying that, your lulya kebab is actually is kotlets. üëé
Delicious food!
Fantastic kosher restaurant. Great food and fantastic value.
Dishes are very big and priced very reasonably. Flavors are great.

Chebureki ate the top!
Nice servers

Cheburechnaya was a huge disappointment. If you are looking for zero service with a mandatory 18% service charge, this is the place.
‚Ä¢	Our server barely spoke English, so ordering felt like a guessing game.
‚Ä¢	Water was dropped on the table in a giant cup, and we were left to serve ourselves. No refills, no check-ins.
‚Ä¢	While we were still eating, staff couldn‚Äôt wait to grab our plates and cutlery ‚Äî as if rushing us out.
‚Ä¢	To top it all off, the bill came with a forced 18% gratuity that was never mentioned beforehand.

I don‚Äôt mind tipping for good service, but charging customers for service that doesn‚Äôt exist is unacceptable. Definitely not coming back.

Almost no service at all. They just gave us a pitcher of water and we had to pour it ourselves. While we were still eating, they came and took away our plates and even the skewers from the kebabs. The most frustrating part was that they forced an 18% gratuity on the bill. Were they starving for tips or what?

I'm obsessed with this spot. The lamb ribs with fat kebab and the cheburek special were insanely good. The meat was so juicy and so flavorful. The lagman soup was also a nice appetizer. If you're a fan of lamb, this is 100% the spot for you.

This was my first time trying this restaurant, and it was a great experience. We ordered the pilaf rice to share, along with lamb kebabs, lamb ribs with fat, and lamb testicles. The flavors were excellent, especially the kebabs and the ribs with fat. The testicles were tender, chewy, and surprisingly flavorful. My favorite dish, however, was the Goshtgizhda‚Äîa round bread filled with diced lamb meat. Absolutely delicious! Overall, this is a wonderful spot for both lunch and dinner.
Fubar on the menu 2 4 u 2 receipts
just so so

Interesting place in Rego park.
Be ready to have a dinner in pretty much loud atmosphere.
Food is good, but not ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù how is usually expected from Uzbek restaurants.
Girls working there are really nice and friendly.
Delicious Bukharian food, everything tastes great and service is spot on.
This place was great. Excellent menu, ambiance and service.
Awesome food, great salads.
Chebureki were outstanding, as well as the soup, lagman, and liver. Good service, too.

If you love skewers, especially lamb, I really recommend giving this place a try. The prices are low, the portions are big, and most importantly, the flavor is great. The soup is light and refreshing, and the fried items are super crispy. I was honestly surprised by how much meat was packed inside the Goshtgizhda. As a lamb lover, I‚Äôm a big fan of this place.
Amazing meal during lunch with a co-worker who is a regular. Delicious family-style options. The liver kebabs have been on my mind weeks after. Must return soon (thanks Alex!).

First time dining here. As Slovenian we're very familiar with the food, but this was our worst experience. We ordered pelmeni with chicken (dumplings) and chebureki with chicken it was absolutely terrible. The meat had no taste whatsoever and close to expired. The size of pelmeni is like for a 4 year old (we ordered large). Overpriced as well, and we know what we're talking about since we cook at home. Service was OK. But we would not recommend this place
Delicious
Excellent
Best place fresh food
BEST kebabs in queens!!! Generous portions and reasonable prices! Service is pretty good. They serve beer and wine. Great restaurant!!!! I will be back again!!!!

Everything was excellent ! Love the flavor of the pilaf and the meat samsa and the marana sauce everything was perfect! Can‚Äôt wait to come back !! Beef skirt , samcy meat, and vegetables shish are my favorite !!! Huge portion ! Took a lot to go !
Delicious lunch & nice quiet atmosphere.

Yum this place is so good! I love the pilaf (regular, not green), cheburek, samsy, lagman soup, and kebabs. The staff is nice and it's never been crowded when I've gone. The portions are HUGE - you will be stuffed and will still need a to-go container. Highly recommend, it's worth the trip.
Cheap and delicious. Huge selection of central asian food
Terrible service. Adding 18% service automatically is insane, when they do not deserve it. Food came an hour later, dry, orders with mistakes. And then asking for 18%. Insane
The worst service ever, don‚Äôt go there,  the waiters scream at me, I prefer spending my $$$ where they treat me better‚Ä¶
Decent middle eastern food. The prices are great, the service is respectable, and it's very clean. The meat was tender and portions were a good size. I recommend it.
I come to this place pretty regularly, and today I was unpleasantly surprised. Not only have they raised their prices, but they‚Äôve made their portions smaller.

Ordered takeout, chebureki, and couple of salads. Salads were horrible, they literally took left overs from the table and packed it to go. Chebureki had raw meat inside and tasted horrible. Been coming to this place for over 10 years and never coming back again. The staff was so rude when I confronted them.
Best liver and sweetbreads I ever had

Best pilaf and kebab I've had in years.
Veal liver kebab was something outta this world. Big portions. I'm in love with this place.
Ordered two plovs and they loaded it with rice and bones with not a single piece of meat. Very disappointing and even insulting. Last time we ever order from them.
Good food from Uzbekistan
3 times I ordered online and 3 times they canceled me. They do not update the schedule on their website. The food is very good but online orders are a disaster.
Delicious food for an incredibly reasonable price. Service was fantastic.
Shashlik kuygan ekan...., beetibor pishirgan kuygan shashlik bervoribdi
Great staff, and friendly regulars. Everything we had was delicious!
Ordered take out. Fast service, great food

Missed this neighborhood spot and so glad to dine here again. Loved everything especially the skirt steak, chicken wing, and lamb fat rib kebab. The salads are fresh and the bread is amazing! The skinny fries are addictive!
The service is great and the workers are super friendly. They have tables for large group too which is great.

The food isn‚Äôt expensive relatively to other places how ever the quality is average in my opinion had way better but the worst part is the service. I ordered Quil at the end I decided to cancel they stated it‚Äôs already on the grill 40 min after my meal it was still not ready than they informed quil isn‚Äôt available after I was done paying and my only option was to order something else and wait which I did and anyhow continuous issues.
Bu joy juddaxam  z√µr  maxsulotlariga gap yo ªq  good üëç‚Ä¶

This a great spot for a quick healthy meal- they have soups, kebabs, fresh salads. Pretty big space I saw the companies of 10-20 people at one table so it‚Äôs good for small and big groups. It‚Äôs very reasonable priced and they open till late. My favorite was the soup with big piece of lamb. Lamb Kebab was ok. Service was great all nice and accommodating. Parking is street parking- depends on your luck and a day)
I would come back.

Home-style and kosher-friendly restaurant! Fast-paced service and seems to be always busy. They have a wide selection of meats, which is great for meat-lovers!

Decently priced and all the dishes are delicious. Everything on the menu is kosher. (If you order the borscht, don‚Äôt expect sour cream on top) All the servers were friendly and the service was quick.

They have gender neutral restrooms.

objectively one of the most tasteless places I've ever eaten. My favorite lagman and chebureks with meat mix were ordered. Everything is just disgusting, the most tasteless lagman that I have ever eaten, it's kind of amazing how you can spoil it, as well as the most tasteless cheburek. one didn't even finish eating. the meat is too finely ground and the onion looked a lot that the feeling is that the proportion with meat is 50/50, as if not to feel the taste of spoiled meat, I don't see any other options. In the evening, a friend had a stomach ache. I haven't eaten anything all day, because only because of the food in Cheburechnaya. I wanted to go there so much and was so disappointed. Yes, he also has the audacity to enter TIPS AUTOMATICALLY! I don't understand - are the waiters on my salary? If it wasn't for the sorority, I wouldn't be paying for tea. So I didn't sign up for this.Of course, don't set foot there anymore

Listen, I order today this disgusting food cannot believe I was charged so much money for dry meat inside the patty. If you guys are planning to keep your restaurant running, you shouldn‚Äôt treat food like it‚Äôs garbage. This was horrible. This is Glatt Kosher restaurant that charges a lot of money for subpar low bar food horrible I will. I will be back and I‚Äôll show you the manager or the boss what type of food you guys are giving people to go this is no way to run a restaurant or a business horrific disgusting waste of money

Delicious food at reasonable prices. Great selection of Russian and Uzbeki cuisine. I usually come here for lunch, the interior is a bit old school and not enough to use this place for dinner. Portions are big and you can get Pilaf that will feed 4ppl for $15. Most of the time I end up taking food to go as it's so much to eat. Recommend for lunch for sure.

One of my favorite places in queens. go here. charcoal grilled meats and fish. great green rice pilaf. fantastic grilled lamb ribs. the pelmene soup is beautiful. very nice chicken broth. Chebureki with meat is great. skip the Chebureki‚Ä¶
Food is very tasty, portions huge, everything on grill, definitely will come back, prices very affordable.
Great food.  Everything was very tasty.  I wish that the restaurant had more of an ambient theme, time to decorate it better. Two thumbs up

I lived in rego park 10 years ago , ever since, I always come back once for a while !!! My all time fav is fat lamb rib (kebab ) .you have to eat with onion ..many years ago, the provide seasoned onion but now it‚Äôs fresh onion !
We dined in on Thursday night, food was good but the dessert chack chack was dry and not fresh, I told the server blond girl she was rude saying that it is fresh.

Nice place, delicious food. Staff is attentive. Called a few times to make a reservation and twice they seated us at the wrong place because they double booked another party. So you kind of sit where its available.

Incredible experience eating out here with friends with lots of food options that are just completely delicious. We had four people in the group so we got a lapioshka, cheborekye, samsy, fresh salad pelimeni soup to start and for the main course chicken wings, lamb ribs and garlic french fries. The food was delicious and well seasoned. My friends told me how they have young Mexicans who speak Russian working down stairs carving out the meat. I thought that was hilarious there was more said that I would not care to share here cuz it's going to sound crazy.

I ordered food delivery and im so impressed to have such delicious dinner. Everything including salad was fresh and tasty. And delivery was very fastüëçüèª thank you for this amazing experience and home style food!

Cool place for Uzbek / Eastern Food
Plov was delicious
Manti were very good
Finished meal with some green tea
Utterly delicious food at very palatable prices. Service is polite and quick enough and the place is clean enough. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Queens.

This was a fun novelty. I didn't know NYC has a Uzbeki neighborhood. Had the chebureki with meat (fried dough stuffed with lamb and beef), the goshtgizdha (baked dough stuffed with lamb), the pelmeni (dumpling soup), and the lulya kebab‚Ä¶
Great place to try some kosher Eastern European cuisine. They have the best ‚ÄúChebureki‚Äù in NY!
Really tasty food. The lamb rice and fried thing we're delicious.  Everything else was good and warm.

Good food. Inside feels homie. Bathrooms were clean. The kitchen is visible to customers and it‚Äôs not hidden like other restaurants. This is a huge bonus because I could see how clean they worked and food was fresh. This place is healthy and safe to eat at. Solid 5 star and I can not say anything bad.
Wow! The meat/kebab/chicken tastes so good! The pickled vegetables so so good, and the special pastry (forgot the name) was crunchy and moist.  Delicious
Big menu with a big variety of Russian and Uzbek food. Portions are good size, not too big,  not too small. Personnel speaks Russian and English.

Worst waiters I have ever seen in my life... You have to ask for water, knife and napkin. Kebabs were burnt or raw. They gave me warm beer. When I asked for an ice bucket they said "We are very busy". The waiters take your food before you finish it. You also have to wait a long time for check to pay!
Loved this Buharian food! Thank god i had my friend to help me order from the menu.

This is a terrific spot for some unique and tasty ethnic food. The prices are reasonable,  the dining area is clean, and the staff is polite. My primary criticism is that they make unusual (and sometimes objectionable) decisions about the‚Ä¶
Uuuu ,this place rocks, all good memories and fantastic food !!!!
La m√∫sica agradable, lugar acogedor, trajeron primero la comida rice pilaf, salm√≥n Kebab, beef skirt y despu√©s el appetizer ü§®! Recomendado üëçüèæ

Today, my boyfriend and I visited cheburechnaya, eager to indulge in some Buharian cuisine. Unfortunately, our experience was a letdown, particularly with the cheburechnaya salad, shish kebab, baba ghanoush.
Shish kebab, typically a flavorful and tender, usually vibrant flavors of marinated chicken were muted, leaving the dish tasteless. Cheburechnaya salad was a major disappointmen. It lacked the essential spices and herbs that make  savory and aromatic. Worse still, it was not fresh undersalted, making each bite bland.
The service was friendly, but the staff seemed overwhelmed, leading to slow service. The ambiance was pleasant, with cozy decor, but it couldn't compensate for the subpar food.
Our experience fell short of expectations.  Hopefully, they will revisit their recipes and improve their dishes to better serve their customers.
